com.esri.mo2.cs.geom
Class BasePath

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.BasePath
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Curve, Geometry, Path
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseRing
public class BasePath
extends Object
implements Path

Standard implementation of Path.

Any implementation of path should extend this class, although generally that won't be necessary. BaseRing extends BasePath for its implementation of Ring.

A path is an ordered collection of points with a line "drawn" between successive points. A Polyline is a feature geometry with a collection of paths (which do not cross). A path's endpoints are its Clementini boundary, while its interior is everything in between the endpoints (along the lines).

See Also:
BaseRing, Ring, Polyline, ClementiniGeometry

getEnvelopeByRef

public Envelope getEnvelopeByRef()
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Determines the bounding box of the geometry. This method returns a reference to an existing envelope.

This method is provided to reduce memory consumption and should be used with care. Modifications should not be made to the returned envelope. Implementing classes are free to return an actual reference or a completely new object providing it is stated in the method's documentation.

Specified by:
getEnvelopeByRef in interface Geometry
Returns:
the envelope bounding box

pathDisjointLine

protected boolean pathDisjointLine(double x1,
                                   double y1,
                                   double x2,
                                   double y2,
                                   boolean bOpenRing)
Indicates whether the given line is disjoint from the path.

Parameters:
x1 - the x (abscissa) of the start point of the line
y1 - the y (ordinate) of the start point of the line
x2 - the x (abscissa) of the end point of the line
y2 - the y (ordinate) of the end point of the line
bOpenRing - indicates whether this path is open or closed(if its a ring)
Returns:
true is disjoint otherwise false

clem_touchPoint

public boolean clem_touchPoint(double px,
                               double py)
Description copied from interface: Path
Determines if a point "touches" a path/ring. A point can touch a path at its two endpoints. A point can touch a ring anywhere along its boundary

Specified by:
clem_touchPoint in interface Path
Parameters:
px - the X ordinate
py - the Y ordinate
Returns:
a boolean value -True if the point touches the path/ring, else False

onPath

protected boolean onPath(double px,
                         double py,
                         boolean closed)
Indicates if the specified point is on the path, including the path's endpoints. Note that this different from clem_onBoundary because clem_onBoundary returns true only if the point is on the Clementini boundary. A path's boundary is its two endpoints. A ring's boundary is the entire path (which is equivalent to onPath).

Parameters:
px - the point's x value (abscissa)
py - the point's y value (ordinate)
closed - indicates whether this ring is closed (true) or needs to be closed (false)
Returns:
returns true if on the path otherwise false.

check

protected int check(double x1,
                    double y1,
                    double x2,
                    double y2,
                    boolean bOpenRing,
                    boolean bRing,
                    int[] nnContain,
                    int iRelate)
public int check(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) { int iCheck = ClementiniGeometry.DISJOINT; return check(x1, y1, x2, y2, false, false, new int[1], iCheck); }

equals

public boolean equals(Object geometry)
Determines if the two paths are equal. Equality is determined if both paths have an equal number of points with same coordinates, and are in the same order.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
See Also:
